'Strychnine' (; also or ) is a highly toxic ( = 0.16 mg/kg in rats,
1â2 mg/kg orally in humans INCHEM: Chemical Safety Information from
Intergovernmental Organizations:Strychnine.
http://www.inchem.org/documents/pims/chemical/pim507.htm ), colorless
crystalline alkaloid used as a pesticide, particularly for killing small
vertebrates such as birds and rodents. Strychnine causes muscular convulsions
and eventually death through asphyxia. The most common
source is from the seeds of the [[Strychnine tree|Strychnos nux-vomica]] tree.
